intro: Stravadium luzonense, commonly known as Luzon's stravadium, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
